The base testcase didn't need to keep a reference to the sys.exit
mockpatch fixture.

Also, added a unit test for calling sys.exit() since there wasn't
one.

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-11-28 10:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/server.py', 'heat/tests/test_nova_client.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/nova.py', 'heat/tests/test_server.py'], 'message': "Add console_urls attribute to server resource

This is a composite attribute that returns a dict-like structure
lazily resolving the actual console URL based on key supplied or dict of
all available consoles if no key is provided.
Example of usage to get only 'novnc' console:

  outputs:
    console:
      value: { get_attr: [server, console_urls, novnc ] }

Change-Id: I27c0426f1a9100bb483f04c059fec87bb69b6340
Implements: blueprint vnc-console-attr
Co-Authored-By: Jun Jie Nan <nanjj@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add console_urls attribute to server resource

This is a composite attribute that returns a dict-like structure
lazily resolving the actual console URL based on key supplied or dict of
all available consoles if no key is provided.
Example of usage to get only 'novnc' console:

  outputs:
    console:
      value: { get_attr: [server, console_urls, novnc ] }

Change-Id: I27c0426f1a9100bb483f04c059fec87bb69b6340
Implements: blueprint vnc-console-attr
Co-Authored-By: Jun Jie Nan <nanjj@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Always import heat.rpc.api as rpc_api

heat.rpc.api was being imported as rpc_api in some modules and engine_api
in other modules.  Always import heat.rpc.api as rpc_api for consistency.

Change-Id: Ic84ca7fbac7a95eace7f2019c08ee20fa1bc8e5e

subject: Use the right log marker functions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3098, 'name': 'Jeff Peeler', 'email': 'jpeeler@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpeeler-z'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-02 13:05:36.000000000', 'files': ['bin/heat-api-cloudwatch', 'heat/cloudinit/loguserdata.py', 'heat/common/profiler.py', 'heat/common/wsgi.py', 'heat/common/lifecycle_plugin_utils.py', 'heat/engine/resources/aws/autoscaling_group.py', 'heat/common/exception.py', 'heat/engine/api.py', 'heat/common/heat_keystoneclient.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'bin/heat-api-cfn', 'bin/heat-api', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Use the right log marker functions

According to [1] _LI() should be used for LOG.info(), _LE() for
LOG.exception() and LOG.error(), _LW() for LOG.warning().
The log marker functions must only be used when the message is
sent directly to the log.
Debug level log messages should not be translated.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Change-Id: Ib9f92ef6696b9a95ddae74f0d4a0a557c06ecc91
'}]
commit_message:
Use the right log marker functions

According to [1] _LI() should be used for LOG.info(), _LE() for
LOG.exception() and LOG.error(), _LW() for LOG.warning().
The log marker functions must only be used when the message is
sent directly to the log.
Debug level log messages should not be translated.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Change-Id: Ib9f92ef6696b9a95ddae74f0d4a0a557c06ecc91

commit_message:
Display action column buttons on single line

Fixed actions column buttons to be displayed on a single line by
setting the td.actions_column width to 1em so the column dynamically
adjust, but by setting width to 1em (vs 0) stops tables with less
columns(Host Aggregates for example) having their actions column
expand overally wide, and by changing td.actions_column .btn-group
display to inline-flex.

Change-Id: I7dcb338f9f82e4b6eb88894068a9c4fb9879cf80
Closes-Bug: #1349615

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-11-27 11:41:40.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/pages/pageobject.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/tests/test_dashboard_help_redirection.py'], 'message': "Integration tests - switch_window method

I added the switch_window method to pageobject, so that it can be
used by all pages.
The method switches focus between the webdriver windows.
Args:
- window_name: The name of the window to switch to.
- window_index: The index of the window handle to switch to.
If the method is called without arguments it switches to the
last window in the driver window_handles list.
In case only one window exists nothing effectively happens.
Usage:
page.switch_window('_new')
page.switch_window(2)
page.switch_window()

The motivation of writing it was to prevent the inconsistencies
encountered lately, and the common use of a deprecated similar method.
It is not meant for handling pop-ups.

I also modified test_dashboard_help_redirectionת so it now uses
the switch_window method.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Closes-Bug: #1354824

Change-Id: Ic90accc37af292994656e1b65ad5c8527b50aaed
"}]
commit_message:
Integration tests - switch_window method

I added the switch_window method to pageobject, so that it can be
used by all pages.
The method switches focus between the webdriver windows.
Args:
- window_name: The name of the window to switch to.
- window_index: The index of the window handle to switch to.
If the method is called without arguments it switches to the
last window in the driver window_handles list.
In case only one window exists nothing effectively happens.
Usage:
page.switch_window('_new')
page.switch_window(2)
page.switch_window()

The motivation of writing it was to prevent the inconsistencies
encountered lately, and the common use of a deprecated similar method.
It is not meant for handling pop-ups.

I also modified test_dashboard_help_redirectionת so it now uses
the switch_window method.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Closes-Bug: #1354824

Change-Id: Ic90accc37af292994656e1b65ad5c8527b50aaed

commit_message:
Security groups: prevent race for default security group creation

When a VM is booted via the Nova the client connection is created
with an admin user. This causes problems when creating the neutron
port. That is, there may be a race for the creation of the default
security group for the tenant.
The problem was introduced by commit acf44dba26ca8dca47bfb5fb2916807f9f4e2060

Change-Id: Ie0199c71231a322704f1f49995facde09c92da25
Closes-bug: #1372570
(cherry picked from commit 32ea2e349decd750e25cb00a8c907b8f73f795f3)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-17 20:01:46.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/network/json/network_client.py', 'tempest/api/network/test_routers_dvr.py'], 'message': 'Added 'distributed' attribute to router update

in network_client.py:
update_router in json/network_client.py did
not provide a way to update the 'distributed'
attribute of a router.
Sending a rest call to a system that does
not support dvr (icehouse and older) or a
a system with dvr extension disabled will
cause a failure, thus care must be taken
to only include the attribute in the rest
call if it is explicitely requested via the
kwargs dict.

test_router_dvr.py:
Adds api "update" test which uses update_router
from json/network_client.py to verify router
update api for distributed attribute works
correctly in DVR setup

Change-Id: I0dad750fd26f04c616b055a33c94bb308d4f4969
'}]
commit_message:
Added 'distributed' attribute to router update

in network_client.py:
update_router in json/network_client.py did
not provide a way to update the 'distributed'
attribute of a router.
Sending a rest call to a system that does
not support dvr (icehouse and older) or a
a system with dvr extension disabled will
cause a failure, thus care must be taken
to only include the attribute in the rest
call if it is explicitely requested via the
kwargs dict.

test_router_dvr.py:
Adds api "update" test which uses update_router
from json/network_client.py to verify router
update api for distributed attribute works
correctly in DVR setup

Change-Id: I0dad750fd26f04c616b055a33c94bb308d4f4969

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-12-04 01:31:29.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/v1_1/fakes.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/v3/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py', 'novaclient/utils.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/volumes.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_volumes.py'], 'message': 'Specify volume arguments by name with volume-attach subcommand

By this patch, a user is able to specify volume name or uuid
 with "volume-attach".

Before appying this patch:
$ nova volume-attach test-server0 test-vol0
ERROR (BadRequest): Bad volumeId format: volumeId is not in
 proper format (test-vol0) (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-...)

After appying this patch:
$ nova volume-list
+--------+-----------+--------------+------+-------------+-------------+
| ID     | Status    | Display Name | Size | Volume Type | Attached to |
+--------+-----------+--------------+------+-------------+-------------+
| 16 ... | available | test-vol1    | 1    | lvmdriver-1 |             |
| 6d ... | available | test-vol1    | 1    | lvmdriver-1 |             |
| c9 ... | available | test-vol0    | 1    | lvmdriver-1 |             |
+--------+-----------+--------------+------+-------------+-------------+
$ nova volume-attach test-server0 test-vol0
+----------+--------------------------------------+
| Property | Value                                |
+----------+--------------------------------------+
| device   | /dev/vdb                             |
| id       | c99b66da-2fce-470f-9ba4-9c276e5312a4 |
| serverId | 6eb03eef-a051-4ff8-a156-f23bed0c7c60 |
| volumeId | c99b66da-2fce-470f-9ba4-9c276e5312a4 |
+----------+--------------------------------------+

If a user has same name of volumes, it can not attach to instance
 by volume name.

$ nova volume-attach test-server0 test-vol1
Attach to volume test-vol1 failed: Multiple volume matches found \
 for 'test-vol1', use an ID to be more specific.

In above case a user can be specified uuid of target volume.

$ nova volume-attach test-server0 16f9d43d-0b3b-4721-8ab5-3c873ef27c76
+----------+--------------------------------------+
| Property | Value                                |
+----------+--------------------------------------+
| device   | /dev/vdc                             |
| id       | 16f9d43d-0b3b-4721-8ab5-3c873ef27c76 |
| serverId | 6eb03eef-a051-4ff8-a156-f23bed0c7c60 |
| volumeId | 16f9d43d-0b3b-4721-8ab5-3c873ef27c76 |
+----------+--------------------------------------+

Change-Id: I5d668afc9ce746759910e37562fefc493eb88898
Closes-Bug: #931590
'}]
commit_message:
Specify volume arguments by name with volume-attach subcommand

By this patch, a user is able to specify volume name or uuid
 with "volume-attach".

Before appying this patch:
$ nova volume-attach test-server0 test-vol0
ERROR (BadRequest): Bad volumeId format: volumeId is not in
 proper format (test-vol0) (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-...)

After appying this patch:
$ nova volume-list
+--------+-----------+--------------+------+-------------+-------------+
| ID     | Status    | Display Name | Size | Volume Type | Attached to |
+--------+-----------+--------------+------+-------------+-------------+
| 16 ... | available | test-vol1    | 1    | lvmdriver-1 |             |
| 6d ... | available | test-vol1    | 1    | lvmdriver-1 |             |
| c9 ... | available | test-vol0    | 1    | lvmdriver-1 |             |
+--------+-----------+--------------+------+-------------+-------------+
$ nova volume-attach test-server0 test-vol0
+----------+--------------------------------------+
| Property | Value                                |
+----------+--------------------------------------+
| device   | /dev/vdb                             |
| id       | c99b66da-2fce-470f-9ba4-9c276e5312a4 |
| serverId | 6eb03eef-a051-4ff8-a156-f23bed0c7c60 |
| volumeId | c99b66da-2fce-470f-9ba4-9c276e5312a4 |
+----------+--------------------------------------+

If a user has same name of volumes, it can not attach to instance
 by volume name.

$ nova volume-attach test-server0 test-vol1
Attach to volume test-vol1 failed: Multiple volume matches found \
 for 'test-vol1', use an ID to be more specific.

In above case a user can be specified uuid of target volume.

$ nova volume-attach test-server0 16f9d43d-0b3b-4721-8ab5-3c873ef27c76
+----------+--------------------------------------+
| Property | Value                                |
+----------+--------------------------------------+
| device   | /dev/vdc                             |
| id       | 16f9d43d-0b3b-4721-8ab5-3c873ef27c76 |
| serverId | 6eb03eef-a051-4ff8-a156-f23bed0c7c60 |
| volumeId | 16f9d43d-0b3b-4721-8ab5-3c873ef27c76 |
+----------+--------------------------------------+

Change-Id: I5d668afc9ce746759910e37562fefc493eb88898
Closes-Bug: #931590

commit_message:
Remove Python 2.6 classifier

Trove does not support Python 2.6 anymore starting with Kilo and might
not work correctly with it, so remove the classifier.

Change-Id: Ida17ce3ce76258442222b591846e1e1717119eed

commit_message:
Switch to using run-tox.sh everywhere.

Stop using run-unittests.sh. It creates confusion when people create
jobs. Instead standardize on run-tox.sh. This means rewriting all the
jobs that use run-unittests.sh to use run-tox.sh.

Note that this depends on the parent change to merge first and have all
our slave images rebuilt prior to merging this change.

Change-Id: Ib81403c25485b120f48080a59f1894dc2130c05f

Sets server attributes only after verifying that

Risk of fix: With this fix the server.host, server.local_id,

client.servers.get(instance.server_id). See bug notes for

commit_message:
Check for server attributes before using them

Sets server attributes only after verifying that
they exist.

Risk of fix: With this fix the server.host, server.local_id,
server.deleted, server.deleted_at values could get set with
values from information loaded per
client.servers.get(instance.server_id). See bug notes for
more details

Change-Id: I6d8303fee0ab685bdbe66b044174a7bd9f0807a4
Closes-Bug:1376525

subject: Add ability to create volume from image by image name
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1207, 'name': 'Duncan Thomas', 'email': 'duncan.thomas@gmail.com', 'username': 'duncan-thomas'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-25 18:39:28.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add ability to create volume from image by image name

Follow on change from cinder code to all specifying an
image by either its name or ID for creating a volume.

This patch adds the --image option that will take either
ID or name as input. The service then will attempt to
locate the image to use and make sure there are not
multiple images with the same name.

If both --image-id and --image are used it will favor
the more explicit ID.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1377823

Change-Id: I77d58258144970fac47da6da6b7870f2931e1823
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to create volume from image by image name

Follow on change from cinder code to all specifying an
image by either its name or ID for creating a volume.

This patch adds the --image option that will take either
ID or name as input. The service then will attempt to
locate the image to use and make sure there are not
multiple images with the same name.

If both --image-id and --image are used it will favor
the more explicit ID.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1377823

Change-Id: I77d58258144970fac47da6da6b7870f2931e1823

commit_message:
Inherit Context from oslo

In the long-term, OpenStack projects should use oslo.context as the base
class for their custom contexts. This enables the use of
application-agnostic tools, e.g. global logging configurations.

This patch uses the Context class from oslo-incubator (which will be
soon replaced by oslo.context) as the base class for Sahara Context.
The goal is to be ready for the first oslo.context release.

Change-Id: If7abc705b431aa97cd9d1c59f863d15e6a4fbdef
Partially implements: blueprint app-agnostic-logging-parameters

Add the max_delay parameter to prevent running all cron jobs at the
exact same time in case this cron job is installed on more than one

Change-Id: I1cd231305a1ecc642c638af6cef7d591d1e3fe3e
(cherry picked from commit 8e502087aa2c3a4970fac7a33622072a377e9bdf)

commit_message:
Allow disabling or delaying the token_flush cron

Add the max_delay parameter to prevent running all cron jobs at the
exact same time in case this cron job is installed on more than one
server. The default is to not wait though.

Add the ensure parameter to allow removing the cron job.

Change-Id: I1cd231305a1ecc642c638af6cef7d591d1e3fe3e
(cherry picked from commit 8e502087aa2c3a4970fac7a33622072a377e9bdf)

subject: Add vmware support and external configuration for Vagrantfile
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1925, 'name': 'Vipul Sabhaya', 'email': 'vipuls@gmail.com', 'username': 'vipuls'}, {'_account_id': 13771, 'name': 'Davide Agnello', 'email': 'dagnello@hp.com', 'username': 'dagnello'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-19 03:16:08.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'Vagrantfile', 'vagrant_config.rb.sample'], 'message': 'Add vmware support and external configuration for Vagrantfile

A different box needs to be specified for vmware as the ubuntu/trusty64
box repository does not provide a vmware box.

An external configuration file ("vagrant_config.rb") can be used to set
options for the vagrant environment.  By default tmate and devstack is
not being installed.  vagrant_config.rb.sample can be used as a basis
for configuring the environment.

Change-Id: I3948dea172943e25ae229840381f263c89bc9d55
'}]
commit_message:
Add vmware support and external configuration for Vagrantfile

A different box needs to be specified for vmware as the ubuntu/trusty64
box repository does not provide a vmware box.

An external configuration file ("vagrant_config.rb") can be used to set
options for the vagrant environment.  By default tmate and devstack is
not being installed.  vagrant_config.rb.sample can be used as a basis
for configuring the environment.

Change-Id: I3948dea172943e25ae229840381f263c89bc9d55

commit_message:
Connecting REST API to DB, part I

    * Implemented Clusters POST URI functionality which creates a
      new cluster
    * Added new create_cluster function in DB API
    * Added new get_clusters_nodes function in DB API
    * Updated DB scema
    ** Removed endpoint_types table and merged content in endpoints
       table
    ** Added volume_size column in clusters and nodes tables
    ** Added deleted (boolean) column in clusteers, nodes and endpoints
       tables
    * Added 'add' class method in DB Cluster, Node and Endpoint classes

Change-Id: Ie7f03dc0a0d9d143a212b56be179d4f2a162c75b

commit_message:
Drop RpcProxy usage from DhcpAgentNotifyAPI

Remove usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from the
DhcpAgentNotifyAPI class.  The equivalent oslo.messaging APIs are now
used instead.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: Ib658a0d67da1af3b009bc6df9a7c8ec08c04897b

Modified "test_create" test to "test_create_get":

 record was actually written to DB.

Added unit tests:
* test_update
* test_delete_invalid_id

Fixed DB model (in cue/db/) related bugs:

* In delete_batch (base.py)
** delete function signature requires dictionary to be passed
* In update (base.py)
** updating 'updated_at' field date/time
* In base.py
** renamed TenantMix class to ProjectMix
* In models.py
** Added inheritance from Cluster class to ProjectMixin class
** Removed project_id instance variable from Cluster class

Change-Id: I80397749b7772bb117fbcd525f3f66cc9e47fc18

commit_message:
Updated/added DB Models Unit Tests and Bug Fixes

Modified "test_create" test to "test_create_get":
* After record is created, added call to get to verify
 record was actually written to DB.

Added unit tests:
* test_update
* test_delete_invalid_id
* test_delete
* test_get_delete_batch

Fixed DB model (in cue/db/) related bugs:

* In delete (base.py)
** added raising exception if record is not found.
* In delete_batch (base.py)
** delete function signature requires dictionary to be passed
* In update (base.py)
** updating 'updated_at' field date/time
* In base.py
** renamed TenantMix class to ProjectMix
* In models.py
** Added inheritance from Cluster class to ProjectMixin class
** Removed project_id instance variable from Cluster class

Change-Id: I80397749b7772bb117fbcd525f3f66cc9e47fc18

commit_message:
VMware: support spawn of stream-optimized image

This adds support of spawning instances using stream-optimized
disk images. This format is better suited as a glance format as it is
compressed, sparsed and optimized for streaming. The change uses the
oslo.vmware library to provide the functionality to transfer the image
to the server by importing it as a virtual machine.

Implements: blueprint vmware-vsan-support
Co-authored-by: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>

Change-Id: I5c5c2aae733a2d55643d2ea5c293873b21325db6

commit_message:
Use versioned objects for bays

This creates and deletes bay objects in the database.

This new model is great because we can do things like:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/cmd/compute.py#L67

And completely override the database with an RPC mechanism instead.
This way objects are created in the ReST endpoint but stored in the
database via the backend and conductor.

I was attempting to write this code, but found it is already on its
way to being merged into oslo-incubator here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/127532/

Change-Id: Iff995d28a78f41874cc6ad62baf7420960a530da

commit_message:
Modify the object registry to support ver objects

Versioned objects are a nice way to pass objects around via RPC
which is necessary in our decided architecture.  Trying to implement
this again is pointless, as this code will soon enter oslo incubation
and likely become standard across projects.

commit_message:
Copy Ironic's database model codebase

The Ironic codebase is pretty simple for database access.  This work
leads into the introduction of versioned object technology from nova
and ironic that will be entering oslo:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/127532/

This will drastically speed up the process of implementing moving the
RPC objects across the network.

Change-Id: I38aa451b658b66f5b6f10ced03ea2e0355af4ecd

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 8215, 'name': 'Tim Hinrichs', 'email': 'timothy.l.hinrichs@gmail.com', 'username': 'thinrich'}, {'_account_id': 12875, 'name': 'Alexander Yip', 'email': 'ayip@vmware.com', 'username': 'ayip'}, {'_account_id': 13050, 'name': 'VMWare Congress CI', 'email': 'congressci@gmail.com', 'username': 'vmware-congress-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-12-03 21:52:31.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datasources/swift_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/neutron_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/cinder_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/keystone_driver.py', 'congress/tests/test_congress.py', 'congress/datasources/glancev2_driver.py', 'congress/tests/datasources/test_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/plexxi_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/benchmark_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/ceilometer_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/nova_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix race condition in Datasources

Sometimes update_from_datasource() can be called before
init() finishes.  This leads to errors.  This fix
adds a sleep loop at the start of update_from_datasource()
to wait until init() finishes.

Change-Id: I7ffe354421718964873b801448e70191e0fafbb3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in Datasources

Sometimes update_from_datasource() can be called before
init() finishes.  This leads to errors.  This fix
adds a sleep loop at the start of update_from_datasource()
to wait until init() finishes.

Change-Id: I7ffe354421718964873b801448e70191e0fafbb3

commit_message:
Correct columns covered in migrations_instance_uuid_and_status_idx

Migration 142 added a new index migrations_instance_uuid_and_status_idx
that covers columns deleted, instance_uuid and status, but the index
added to the model only covers instance_uuid and status.

Change-Id: I6ffdeabbab54223b2be844048917588adaceb9bb
Partially-implements: blueprint validate-migrations-and-model

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-02 18:03:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_firewall.py'], 'message': "Don't mock external locks with Semaphore

The firewall tests were mocking an oslo.concurrency external lock
with a vanilla Semaphore, which is not correct and broke in the
most recent oslo.concurrency release because the external locks
no longer happen to match the API of Semaphore.

The correct way to handle external locking in unit tests is now
to use the external lock fixture in oslo.concurrency.

Change-Id: I372c79e6b77614f2006d111bb538beacf323ee0c
"}]
commit_message:
Don't mock external locks with Semaphore

The firewall tests were mocking an oslo.concurrency external lock
with a vanilla Semaphore, which is not correct and broke in the
most recent oslo.concurrency release because the external locks
no longer happen to match the API of Semaphore.

The correct way to handle external locking in unit tests is now
to use the external lock fixture in oslo.concurrency.

Change-Id: I372c79e6b77614f2006d111bb538beacf323ee0c

commit_message:
Hard reboot doesn't re-create instance folder

When use share storage like ceph, instance's disk data is in ceph,
instance's disk doesn't rely on local instance folder anymore. So
when rebooting a instance, we should create the instance folder if
it is missed.

Closes-Bug: #1349978

Change-Id: I5948c7979a7dbe7764fba6cad1d9867893824024

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-02 16:06:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/sub_base.py', 'neutron/tests/base.py'], 'message': "Fix base test class for functional api testing

To support in-tree functional api testing, the test class common
across all types of testing can't import modules that define
configuration that Tempest also defines because duplicate
configuration definitions result in runtime errors.  A previous change
(I44251db399cd73390a9d1931a7f253662002ba10) moved conflicting imports
to a separate module, but subsequent additions have added new conflicting
imports.

This change creates a new test class that is safe to use for all types
of testing (neutron.tests.sub_base.SubBaseTestCase), ensures that the
existing existing base test class (neutron.tests.base.BaseTestCase)
extends it, and documents their respective responsibilities.  This
will hopefully make it less likely that the functional api job will be
broken by changes to the base test class.

Implements: bp retargetable-functional-testing

Change-Id: Ifa270536481fcb19c476c9c62d89e6c5cae36ca1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix base test class for functional api testing

To support in-tree functional api testing, the test class common
across all types of testing can't import modules that define
configuration that Tempest also defines because duplicate
configuration definitions result in runtime errors.  A previous change
(I44251db399cd73390a9d1931a7f253662002ba10) moved conflicting imports
to a separate module, but subsequent additions have added new conflicting
imports.

This change creates a new test class that is safe to use for all types
of testing (neutron.tests.sub_base.SubBaseTestCase), ensures that the
existing existing base test class (neutron.tests.base.BaseTestCase)
extends it, and documents their respective responsibilities.  This
will hopefully make it less likely that the functional api job will be
broken by changes to the base test class.

Implements: bp retargetable-functional-testing

Change-Id: Ifa270536481fcb19c476c9c62d89e6c5cae36ca1

commit_message:
Hack to avoid race condition in datasource driver

This patch is a simple hack to avoid a race condition that is caused
in deepSix() where it starts an eventlet that call d6run() which results
in calling poll on a datasource driver before its finished __init__.

This fix works by moving the call to Super after the clients have been
initialized.

Change-Id: I609b00955f5242cd654d158f2f5a42d21593bfae

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-23 15:54:15.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/tempest-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "only test libraries in a neutron config

The library testing jobs aren't really about testing the libraries,
they are about sniff testing them in a live deploy. By only using the
neutron jobs we are effectively testing the entirety of the integrated
release, minus a *very* small amount of code in nova.

This will reduce the amount of random fail on these jobs, use a lot
less nodes, and achieve effectively the same results. Any n-net only
breaks that slip through should be addressed by other mechanisms,
because the likelyhood that n-net is so dramatically using libraries
differently from the rest of nova is vanishlying small.

Change-Id: I1dcd8558b98443ffa9a3a01c2e877bd64bb96296
"}]
commit_message:
only test libraries in a neutron config

The library testing jobs aren't really about testing the libraries,
they are about sniff testing them in a live deploy. By only using the
neutron jobs we are effectively testing the entirety of the integrated
release, minus a *very* small amount of code in nova.

This will reduce the amount of random fail on these jobs, use a lot
less nodes, and achieve effectively the same results. Any n-net only
breaks that slip through should be addressed by other mechanisms,
because the likelyhood that n-net is so dramatically using libraries
differently from the rest of nova is vanishlying small.

Change-Id: I1dcd8558b98443ffa9a3a01c2e877bd64bb96296

Update to latest hacking

We need to quickly update global requirements to
unblock the gate to get this fix in 0.9.4 of
hacking
 I4b42d081965b6d898b178cbe9232b47cfed17d8a

Without this fix, the new oslo concurrency shim
is not detected as a module and flake8 fails.

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Adds VMOps unit tests (part 1)

The Hyper-V driver oldest tests (test_hypervapi.py) are proving hard to
maintain.

The tests in test_hypervapi.py in particular can also be refactored and
split in separate TestCases, one of each *ops module.

This commit refactors the first part of the VMOps test cases.

Co-Authored-By: Robert Tingirica <rtingirica@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially implements: blueprint hyper-v-test-refactoring

Change-Id: I359993ef5d15e84dde545b55f1378bdcd629c577

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-03 17:28:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/config.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_config.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Support for explicitly setting emulator

Extended the config object to support a new device type of
"emulator". When set, this value remains persistent across live
migrations and any other operation performed during the lifetime of
the instance. The default behavior is to let libvirt decide the
appropriate emulator, which is how it has always worked.

    [libvirt]
    emulator = /path/to/emulator/kvm

New tests confirm that the XML is being generated correctly.

Co-Authored-By: Rafi Khardalian <rkhardal@cisco.com>

Implements: blueprint libvirt-set-emulator

commit_message:
libvirt: Support for explicitly setting emulator

Extended the config object to support a new device type of
"emulator". When set, this value remains persistent across live
migrations and any other operation performed during the lifetime of
the instance. The default behavior is to let libvirt decide the
appropriate emulator, which is how it has always worked.

    [libvirt]
    emulator = /path/to/emulator/kvm

New tests confirm that the XML is being generated correctly.

Co-Authored-By: Rafi Khardalian <rkhardal@cisco.com>
Change-Id: I82f68e3be3c745f62eef19ac660ce6cdf8bef124

When 'tox -e pep8' fails we don't end up printing
the pip freeze output since pipefail just bails out.
We should capture pip freeze when flake8 passes
or fails. The pipe seems to be a vestige from a previous

commit_message:
print pip freeze even when flake8 fails

When 'tox -e pep8' fails we don't end up printing
the pip freeze output since pipefail just bails out.
We should capture pip freeze when flake8 passes
or fails. The pipe seems to be a vestige from a previous
attempt to save the output into a separate file, we
dont need that anymore. Save the exit code from
the tox command and use that when we exit at the end
of the script.

Change-Id: Ic4590b7a8260a4a652608b1aa8d02beb786143ea

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-24 16:56:37.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_utils.py', 'cinder/hacking/checks.py', 'cinder/tests/zonemanager/test_fc_zone_manager.py', 'cinder/tests/test_backup_driver_base.py', 'cinder/tests/keymgr/test_barbican.py', 'cinder/tests/windows/test_vhdutils.py', 'cinder/tests/test_smbfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_hp_msa.py', 'cinder/tests/test_rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/zonemanager/test_brcd_fc_zone_client_cli.py', 'HACKING.rst', 'cinder/tests/test_glusterfs.py'], 'message': "Fix calls to assert_called_once in unit tests

Mock has a method called assert_called_once_with to check that a mock
was called and the arguments it took were as expected. Mock does not
have a method called assert_called_once and calling it just creates a
mock bound to that name. This means that not only is nothing tested
when assert_called_once is used, the tests also don't warn about this.

This commit attempts to address this in two ways:
    - all occurrences of assert_called_once are replaced with a real
      assertion.
    - the hacking check that nova uses to guard against this has been
      copied to cinder's local hacking checks.

Fixing the assert_called_once issues also highlighted other mistakes
in certain tests which were addressed to make the tests pass.

Due to the nature of mock, this issue is also possible if a method is
misspelt or just mistakenly used and so the hacking check is only
addressing one very specific case. That said, it does appear to be a
common mistake and so is worth singling out.

Change-Id: Iedcc3f48d91f7ebd8878ccc3bca3d023503774bd
Closes-Bug: #1394544
"}]
commit_message:
Fix calls to assert_called_once in unit tests

Mock has a method called assert_called_once_with to check that a mock
was called and the arguments it took were as expected. Mock does not
have a method called assert_called_once and calling it just creates a
mock bound to that name. This means that not only is nothing tested
when assert_called_once is used, the tests also don't warn about this.

This commit attempts to address this in two ways:
    - all occurrences of assert_called_once are replaced with a real
      assertion.
    - the hacking check that nova uses to guard against this has been
      copied to cinder's local hacking checks.

Fixing the assert_called_once issues also highlighted other mistakes
in certain tests which were addressed to make the tests pass.

Due to the nature of mock, this issue is also possible if a method is
misspelt or just mistakenly used and so the hacking check is only
addressing one very specific case. That said, it does appear to be a
common mistake and so is worth singling out.

Change-Id: Iedcc3f48d91f7ebd8878ccc3bca3d023503774bd
Closes-Bug: #1394544

commit_message:
Use oslo function for parsing bool from env var

The tests were previously defining their own way of parsing booleans
from strings.  This change switches to using a function defined in
the oslo.utils.strutils module.

Implements: bp retargetable-functional-testing

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-21 19:10:06.000000000', 'files': ['tools/env_builder.sh'], 'message': 'Add a sample script that can be used to build a test environment

It can be difficult to figure out what to install to get a test
environment that can be used to test all the opportunistic tests,
zookeeper and mysql (with the right user and password and test
database).

This script provides a way to do this on rhel/ubuntu based
environments and can be used to examine how to do this for other
environment types.

I use it with nova boot (on rhel images) and it has worked out
great as a way to rebuild a clean test environment as I need.

Change-Id: I9aef7e5536aa38e951a6411a8e83097339a43955
'}]
commit_message:
Add a sample script that can be used to build a test environment

It can be difficult to figure out what to install to get a test
environment that can be used to test all the opportunistic tests,
zookeeper and mysql (with the right user and password and test
database).

This script provides a way to do this on rhel/ubuntu based
environments and can be used to examine how to do this for other
environment types.

I use it with nova boot (on rhel images) and it has worked out
great as a way to rebuild a clean test environment as I need.

Change-Id: I9aef7e5536aa38e951a6411a8e83097339a43955

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2014-12-01 17:10:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/floating_ip.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_floating_ip.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_api_samples.py', 'nova/tests/functional/v3/test_floating_ips_bulk.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py', 'nova/db/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Optimize 'floating_ip_bulk_create' function

The existing floating_ip_bulk_create() DB API method used a for loop and
a session flush operation for each IP created. This patch consolidates
those many operations into a single INSERT statement, which will
perform better than multiple round-trips to the SQL database. We further
optimize the function by making a return of the changed rows optional.

Change-Id: I5cf075f38696110d2890cfa1ea488ca459d791a3
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize 'floating_ip_bulk_create' function

The existing floating_ip_bulk_create() DB API method used a for loop and
a session flush operation for each IP created. This patch consolidates
those many operations into a single INSERT statement, which will
perform better than multiple round-trips to the SQL database. We further
optimize the function by making a return of the changed rows optional.

Change-Id: I5cf075f38696110d2890cfa1ea488ca459d791a3

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-03 09:06:41.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rabbitmq-server/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/51-rabbitmq'], 'message': "Lowercase rabbitmq nodes

If nodenames use uppercase then there is a mismatch because
rabbitmq uses host's hostname locally and hostname is
lowercased by cloud-init.

This is not a problem by default because controller node names in

Change-Id: I71ed191c83b146b89f140e231920bb3621983bbe
"}]
commit_message:
Lowercase rabbitmq nodes

If nodenames use uppercase then there is a mismatch because
rabbitmq uses host's hostname locally and hostname is
lowercased by cloud-init.

This is not a problem by default because controller node names in
default heat templates are lowercased. But this issue can be observed
if an older/different template is used.

Change-Id: I71ed191c83b146b89f140e231920bb3621983bbe

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-02 14:13:05.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/base.py'], 'message': "Don't block on rpc calls in unit tests

While running unit tests I noticed that all of the test cases from
TestOvsNeutronAgent were taking just over 15 seconds.  This is because
it was waiting for the rpc call response timeout.  Since the tests
weren't actually failing, it's clear the code doesn't actually care
about the response anyway, so just set the messaging config to not
wait for the response.

On my dev box, this dropped test runtime for this file from 1024
seconds to 3 seconds, which is an obvious *HUGE* improvement.

Someone pointed out that an earlier change
(086496bfc45e01cd2905a074d526a7d513bf4ec2) intended to make calls
return immediately for *all* tests, but removing use of RpcProxy
caused this to stop working.

Change-Id: Id07c1d1727a3f4087f0a97681388fb5d69740f8d
"}]
commit_message:
Don't block on rpc calls in unit tests

While running unit tests I noticed that all of the test cases from
TestOvsNeutronAgent were taking just over 15 seconds.  This is because
it was waiting for the rpc call response timeout.  Since the tests
weren't actually failing, it's clear the code doesn't actually care
about the response anyway, so just set the messaging config to not
wait for the response.

On my dev box, this dropped test runtime for this file from 1024
seconds to 3 seconds, which is an obvious *HUGE* improvement.

Someone pointed out that an earlier change
(086496bfc45e01cd2905a074d526a7d513bf4ec2) intended to make calls
return immediately for *all* tests, but removing use of RpcProxy
caused this to stop working.

Change-Id: Id07c1d1727a3f4087f0a97681388fb5d69740f8d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-25 20:20:52.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample', 'etc/cinder/README-cinder.conf.txt', 'tools/config/oslo.config.generator.rc'], 'message': "remove extra modules and libs from config generation

When the libraries that Cinder is dependent upon change their
config options it causes the cinder.sample.conf file to fail
the check_uptodate.sh check.  This causes issues in the gate and/or
people to push up patches with unrelated config files changes.

We don't want to remove the check_uptodate.sh run as it is good to
ensure that legitimate config file changes are committed.  A compromise
is to remove the generation of external options from the sample config file,
leaving just Cinder's options.

This patch implements that proposal by commenting out the
CINDER_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_MODULES and
CINDER_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_LIBRARIES environment variables in
tools/config/oslo.config.generator.rc .  Lines are added to the file
explaining why the options are commented out and explaining how to
regenerate the cinder.conf.sample file with the extra modules and libraries
if desired.

This patch also adds etc/cinder/README-cinder.conf.txt with a note
indicating that the existing cinder.conf.sample file is not a full set
of configuration options.  Directions are included for generating a
full sample config.  This approach is consistent with the approach taken by
Nova.

Change-Id: I77fd77cbf150b29534fe7ede275d13c097e7b000
Closes-bug: 1394396
"}]
commit_message:
remove extra modules and libs from config generation

When the libraries that Cinder is dependent upon change their
config options it causes the cinder.sample.conf file to fail
the check_uptodate.sh check.  This causes issues in the gate and/or
people to push up patches with unrelated config files changes.

We don't want to remove the check_uptodate.sh run as it is good to
ensure that legitimate config file changes are committed.  A compromise
is to remove the generation of external options from the sample config file,
leaving just Cinder's options.

This patch implements that proposal by commenting out the
CINDER_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_MODULES and
CINDER_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_LIBRARIES environment variables in
tools/config/oslo.config.generator.rc .  Lines are added to the file
explaining why the options are commented out and explaining how to
regenerate the cinder.conf.sample file with the extra modules and libraries
if desired.

This patch also adds etc/cinder/README-cinder.conf.txt with a note
indicating that the existing cinder.conf.sample file is not a full set
of configuration options.  Directions are included for generating a
full sample config.  This approach is consistent with the approach taken by
Nova.

Change-Id: I77fd77cbf150b29534fe7ede275d13c097e7b000
Closes-bug: 1394396

commit_message:
Fix layout-checks.py to work in virtualenv

Fix the python interpreter used by layout-checks.py so that the "tox -e
zuul" target works correctly on a local system.

Add the PyYAML dependency needed by layout-checks.py to the tox
configuration for the zuul target.

Add the zuul target to the default list for tox.

Change-Id: Ic4db9fc3bb236d36365abfe966eb9e7769896011

* Add dispersion keystone user
* Give swiftoperator role to dispersion user

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7414, 'name': 'David Wilde', 'email': 'dwilde@redhat.com', 'username': 'd34dh0r53'}, {'_account_id': 12892, 'name': 'Nolan Brubaker', 'email': 'nolan.brubaker@rackspace.com', 'username': 'nrb'}, {'_account_id': 14202, 'name': 'Julian Montez', 'email': 'julian.montez@gmail.com', 'username': 'jmontez'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-03 18:49:00.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/cinder_common/templates/cinder.conf'], 'message': 'Adds the my_ip value to the cinder.conf

This adds the my_ip value which is defaulting to the container address

Closes-Bug: 1398924

commit_message:
Adds the my_ip value to the cinder.conf

This adds the my_ip value which is defaulting to the container address
which causes the iscsi mount problems. This is an issue in Juno +.

Change-Id: Ie1e3d4dbecad97e43a43bcd4ca404a3c30740bd0
Closes-Bug: 1398924

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-12-03 16:09:17.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/cmd/agent.py'], 'message': 'Use _ instead of - for config options

Config options containing "-" don't work when reading
configuration from a file; change these to "_". Leave
the old options for backwards compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #1386486

Change-Id: Ie10a548191effa2a505309d9d4ee32003f9676a2
'}]
commit_message:
Use _ instead of - for config options

Config options containing "-" don't work when reading
configuration from a file; change these to "_". Leave
the old options for backwards compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #1386486

Change-Id: Ie10a548191effa2a505309d9d4ee32003f9676a2

Hacking < 0.9.4 does not handle oslo namespace compatibility imports

commit_message:
update hacking to 0.9.4 to deal with oslo namespace changes

Hacking < 0.9.4 does not handle oslo namespace compatibility imports
correctly in the H302 rule. This means that it will no longer work for
most projects.

Change-Id: I049549702eeec2ccdbd4c9e90e7728ece4ffb626

commit_message:
VMware: optimize resource pool usage

There is no need to query the backend for the cluster resource pool.
This is known at init. Using this save a backend query with a VM
spawn.

Change-Id: I336f8e4a2b68f694ce4a88f7fab76214efb17a0c

commit_message:
Add missing indexes from 203 migration to model

Migration 203 added two new indexes to existing tables, but did not
update the model to include them.

Change-Id: If63e8f6c34bb7e4e43cbbda82346e2caffc8eeff
Partially-implements: blueprint validate-migrations-and-model

commit_message:
Update i18n translation for BigSwitch plugin log msg's

All the log messages now have the required hints. In addition to this
debug messages are not translated.

This is done for the plugins/bigswitch and plugins/common directories

V2.0 API doesn't allow empty string as flavorRef and it returns a
BadRequest response if receiving it.
Now V2.1 API doesn't check it now and this patch makes V2.1 API check.
In addition, this patch adds tests for checking both API behaviors.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I6c80b66102f00c832922cb507b82e9f3b534557f
"}]
commit_message:
Make a flavorRef validation strict

V2.0 API doesn't allow empty string as flavorRef and it returns a
BadRequest response if receiving it.
Now V2.1 API doesn't check it now and this patch makes V2.1 API check.
In addition, this patch adds tests for checking both API behaviors.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I6c80b66102f00c832922cb507b82e9f3b534557f

commit_message:
Create, update and delete hierarchical projects

Changes at basic operations related to projects
were modified to handle projects hierarchy.

This changes includes:
- Create and update projects with parent_project_id
  field
- Avoid deleting projects that are not leaf in the
  hierarchy
- Deny the update of a project's parent
- Limit the max depth of a tree branch (in the
  hierarchy)

Co-Authored-By: Henrique Truta <henrique@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samuel@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago Paiva Brito <thiagop@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Implements: blueprint hierarchical-multitenancy
Change-Id: I036f7f67ae7d106ecb0de688d1125edfadf3f712

commit_message:
Add project specific CI acls

The projects that have their ACLs modified here have had third party CI
vote on them in the last 3 months. Add project specific CI group ACLs so
that these projects can directly manage which accounts are allowed to
vote on them.

Change-Id: Iaf9cbb86cd3077f28bf3c5f02de4718314ac1eef

commit_message:
Handle priority the same way as when create_record

If not it assumes that priority is a part of the record which is now a part of
the record.data

Change-Id: I6c7921b88ac31b0c8f2ffa615e6b1237bcb0b4bc
Closes-Bug: #1398587

commit_message:
Internal error with period overflow

When statistics queried with large period value the overflow
causes error 500. This patch converts the overflow error to
ClientSideError which is returned as 400 bad input error

Change-Id: Iacf89c75428713a151fbe81aa1601df63785f942
Closes-Bug: 1396223
(cherry picked from commit 9f923ae928176ca36ad784fadeea56bfc806e7e1)

subject: close listener connection on stop
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 13290, 'name': 'Oleksii Zamiatin', 'email': 'ozamiatin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ozamiatin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-01 22:15:30.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py', 'oslo/messaging/_executors/impl_eventlet.py'], 'message': 'close listener connection on stop

currently, listener consumers continue to exist after stop() has
been called. this patch explicitly calls cleanup to close the
connection on stop(). it also adds a kill attribute to cleanup to
handle timing issue where self.running may not quit loop before poll
cycle triggered again.

Closes-Bug: #1397459
Change-Id: I2ee7740efd7c0087a33de3211f9d06ef22f3c31e
'}]
commit_message:
close listener connection on stop

currently, listener consumers continue to exist after stop() has
been called. this patch explicitly calls cleanup to close the
connection on stop(). it also adds a kill attribute to cleanup to
handle timing issue where self.running may not quit loop before poll
cycle triggered again.

Closes-Bug: #1397459
Change-Id: I2ee7740efd7c0087a33de3211f9d06ef22f3c31e

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-12-02 09:43:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_block_device_mapping.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Check that volume != root device during boot by image

Currently, if an instance is booted by image and a volume is also
specified, if the volume name == the root device name, the instance
boots from the volume instead of from the image. This change adds a
check that the volume name != the root device name if an image is
specified and raises InvalidRequest if the check fails.

Closes-Bug: #1343924

Change-Id: Id967e04483b9fd12fae0bc9bee1a3e7b978b9fd1
'}]
commit_message:
Check that volume != root device during boot by image

Currently, if an instance is booted by image and a volume is also
specified, if the volume name == the root device name, the instance
boots from the volume instead of from the image. This change adds a
check that the volume name != the root device name if an image is
specified and raises InvalidRequest if the check fails.

Closes-Bug: #1343924

Change-Id: Id967e04483b9fd12fae0bc9bee1a3e7b978b9fd1

commit_message:
Add option to specify node uuid in node-create subcommand

- node-create subcommand now includes -u or --uuid
option that allows the user to specify the uuid if
needed.

- The uuid parameter is optional

Closes-Bug: 1381214

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-21 21:17:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Add @_retry_on_deadlock to _instance_update()

This patch adds the @_retry_on_deadlock decorator
to _instance_update(), which has been observed to be
involved in some deadlock scenarios.  As it is the point
of transaction demarcation based on the presence of
get_session(), this is an appropriate point at which the
transaction can be re-attempted in the case of deadlock.

Change-Id: Id2cfdc129ea3cfc787b73f1f3e9aa286a7c0229a
Closes-bug: 1375467
Cherry-picked from: 68ed3c034ba1b0767694026000723e5255d24a64
'}]
commit_message:
Add @_retry_on_deadlock to _instance_update()

This patch adds the @_retry_on_deadlock decorator
to _instance_update(), which has been observed to be
involved in some deadlock scenarios.  As it is the point
of transaction demarcation based on the presence of
get_session(), this is an appropriate point at which the
transaction can be re-attempted in the case of deadlock.

Change-Id: Id2cfdc129ea3cfc787b73f1f3e9aa286a7c0229a
Closes-bug: 1375467
Cherry-picked from: 68ed3c034ba1b0767694026000723e5255d24a64

successfully. Only include codes for BAD_STATUSES.

commit_message:
Fix worlddump call

Change I8db9dc99da8bb486a07d7ead77031e1c0b419857 modified failure
paths to call worlddump.py, but this instance is looking in the wrong
path; e.g.

---
2014-12-02 20:29:21.371 | The following services are not running after upgrade:  swift-proxy-server
2014-12-02 20:29:21.372 | /opt/stack/new/grenade/check-sanity: line 117: /opt/stack/new/grenade/tools/worlddump.py: No such file or directory
2014-12-02 20:29:21.373 | + die 377 'Failure in check-sanity'
---

Also, ${LOGDIR} isn't defined here, so output to the devstack screen
log dir

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/28/136328/2/check/check-grenade-dsvm/0328b64/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz

Change-Id: I18d96a47469d34e0df51f0a6b9b9e16925a3c3df
(cherry picked from commit 12c6b73261471a57eefe116114fb1c8fe23ca04d)

commit_message:
don't uninstall oslo.config

There is a totally crazy sequencing issue that happens by uninstall
oslo.config here, don't do it. It's an incredibly old work around from
before we installed oslo.config as a non editable install.

Change-Id: Ic2364681e51e82e0d7b374728c177a47e04cbd1b
(cherry picked from commit 010a882dad6aba9b5b135c8fd207c3237a1436c4)

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-12-02 03:40:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_iptables_manager.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py'], 'message': 'iptables_manager: Fix get_binary_name for eventlet

The inspect trick used by get_binary_name does not work for
eventlet non-main threads.  It's actually the case for ofagent
and in that case it yields something like "greenthread.py",
which is not desirable because this module assumes it different
for each programs.  This commit fixes the problem by switching
to use sys.argv.

Closes-Bug: #1367075
Change-Id: I8e765882c58d9991a37f0bbb52cdccc406e287bd
'}]
commit_message:
iptables_manager: Fix get_binary_name for eventlet

The inspect trick used by get_binary_name does not work for
eventlet non-main threads.  It's actually the case for ofagent
and in that case it yields something like "greenthread.py",
which is not desirable because this module assumes it different
for each programs.  This commit fixes the problem by switching
to use sys.argv.

Closes-Bug: #1367075
Change-Id: I8e765882c58d9991a37f0bbb52cdccc406e287bd

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-02 18:26:10.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Filter floating/fixed ip tests for tempest-cells

Fixed ips do not work with current nova-cells.  Floating ips partially
work depending on which database the floating ip pool(s) are created in,
but they don't just work out of the box.  So these tests should be
disabled so we can get closer to a passing job.

Change-Id: I77c011ed3a36757519e07030ced779cee8b108b9

commit_message:
Filter floating/fixed ip tests for tempest-cells

Fixed ips do not work with current nova-cells.  Floating ips partially
work depending on which database the floating ip pool(s) are created in,
but they don't just work out of the box.  So these tests should be
disabled so we can get closer to a passing job.

Change-Id: I77c011ed3a36757519e07030ced779cee8b108b9

commit_message:
Fix dashboard nav, when panelgroup empty

The identity dashboard breaks with a common pattern
and doesn't use a panel group to group panels. When not
using accordion navigation, the last level of navigation is
not shown at all.

Change-Id: Ic76611009eac30658d0af082b0e46cd8f2da1832
Closes-Bug: #1391524

commit_message:
[CDH] Add validation for spark

We add validation code for spark service. SPARK_YARN_HISTORY_SERVER
number should be 0 or 1, and it requires YARN service existing (we
use RESOURCEMANAGER process number to check).

Closes-Bug: #1398679

Change-Id: If96ce6a13005ba2a54dc4a1b060f98405ff67cde

commit_message:
test_dhcp_agent: Fix no-op tests

Fix some uses of assertCalledOnceWith, which seems like a mistake of
assert_called_once_with.

Also, add a hacking check to prevent the mistake.

Closes-Bug: #1397184
Change-Id: I12d077e2724d52eff65d55aff1130fbbb69671b1

As a convenience, allow job execution searches to be filtered by 'status'.
This search key will refer to the "info['status']" field in a JobExecution
record.  Because the "info" dictionary is stored as a string in the database,
and because it contains values from clients that may also contain 'status'
entries in nested objects, a substring search filter on the query is not reliable.
Instead results are filtered by Sahara after they are returned from sqlalchemy.

Partial-Implements: blueprint enable-result-filtering
Change-Id: I090b46514c7c920c3cac1a59a45e527ff87e488d
'}]
commit_message:
Support searching job executions by job status

As a convenience, allow job execution searches to be filtered by 'status'.
This search key will refer to the "info['status']" field in a JobExecution
record.  Because the "info" dictionary is stored as a string in the database,
and because it contains values from clients that may also contain 'status'
entries in nested objects, a substring search filter on the query is not reliable.
Instead results are filtered by Sahara after they are returned from sqlalchemy.

Partial-Implements: blueprint enable-result-filtering
Change-Id: I090b46514c7c920c3cac1a59a45e527ff87e488d

commit_message:
BSN: Set inconsistency record on delete failure

Set a bad value in the consistency DB on a delete
failure so a sync is triggered the next time the backend
servers become available.

This fixes the issue where the backend servers are unavailable
when an object is deleted from ML2 but not deleted from the
backend.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/bigswitch/test_servermanager.py

Closes-Bug: #1377350
Change-Id: I24713a03af4d3499645241f900de1f572689c235
(cherry picked from commit e9f001a63a555f067c4567a88613d14853442524)

commit_message:
BSN: Add network to ext_gw_info sent to backend

Include the full network info in the external gateway info
sent to the backend controller. This alleviates a very expensive
query across all tenants on the backend controller.

Closes-Bug: #1393991
Change-Id: If3601ccbce21e683924a7056cdfe4e3c2d4d4a93

commit_message:
Fix signature validation failure when using qpid message queue

When using qpid message queue, the metering message will get
signature validation failure because of extra unicode encoding
given by json loads. This change peels off unicode of the message
so that this issue can be avoided.

Change-Id: Ia23af789460ad8597867902f713b8a78f4a09e06
Closes-Bug: 1373356
(cherry picked from commit 4166da70b30291e8de74cf8c18e27753d0902ace)

commit_message:
Add support for tuskar-api service

Adds initial support for configuring and starting the tuskar-api
service.

To enable, add the following to your localrc:

enable_service tuskar
enable_service tuskar-api

The aim of this addition is to provide a more accessible (non devtest)
way for developers to run up tuskar in a familiar devstack environment.

See the official repos for more information:
https://github.com/openstack/tuskar/
https://github.com/openstack/python-tuskarclient

Change-Id: Id0c3c0d3a38100c66dbe6e3adf1f715162f99742

commit_message:
Rename apts to debs

apts aren't a thing, debs are. apt-get installs debs, like yum installs
rpms. Another option would be to rename rpms to yums, but that is even
sillier, considering then for suse we'd have to call it "zypper-suse" or
something, even though it would want to consume yums-general as a base.

Include a symlink to the old name to help out with grenade. The symlink
should go away later.

This is a long-standing annoyance of mine.

Related-to: I915f0e59c13d8cf5fb3549c6202f8aa2f8be0856
Change-Id: I0416180db5b6add996ce5b48c6966c1b68adbcb0

catalog. There is no reason to provide an overriding endpoint_template.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-25 13:33:54.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ceph'], 'message': 'Ceph: undefine secret from nova.conf when deleting secret

At teardown time we delete the libvirt secret but leave
nova.conf referencing the stale UUID.  Remove it to make
debugging and repeated runs less error-prone.

Additionally, only try to delete secret if it Cinder is
enabled (causing it to be defined when deploying devstack).

Change-Id: Id5e1290b8dcfd79238f02e31084ab12c3d6aed5f
'}]
commit_message:
Ceph: undefine secret from nova.conf when deleting secret

At teardown time we delete the libvirt secret but leave
nova.conf referencing the stale UUID.  Remove it to make
debugging and repeated runs less error-prone.

Additionally, only try to delete secret if it Cinder is
enabled (causing it to be defined when deploying devstack).

Change-Id: Id5e1290b8dcfd79238f02e31084ab12c3d6aed5f

subject: Return mysql-server to default for all ubuntu installs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 9009, 'name': 'Red Hat CI', 'email': 'redhatci@redhat.com', 'username': 'redhatci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-24 16:07:02.000000000', 'files': ['lib/databases/mysql'], 'message': 'Return mysql-server to default for all ubuntu installs

Change: I97cbede806e5c00363c7174fa1e9f286de96aab6 altered
the logic in lib/databases/mysql from installing mariadb only if
one was using rhel7 to installing it by default unless one was using
rhel6.

Change: Iae9a7a1c09f1fc83573c3926b3470955c244c401
Attempted to fix this, but only does so for precise.

Unless mariadb has become the default, I strongly prefer to keep
standard mysql as the database on ubuntu (precise or otherwise).

Closes-Bug: 1395776

Change-Id: I3afb89ae6d55405313b7219dd6daa24d9ca80f70
'}]
commit_message:
Return mysql-server to default for all ubuntu installs

Change: I97cbede806e5c00363c7174fa1e9f286de96aab6 altered
the logic in lib/databases/mysql from installing mariadb only if
one was using rhel7 to installing it by default unless one was using
rhel6.

Change: Iae9a7a1c09f1fc83573c3926b3470955c244c401
Attempted to fix this, but only does so for precise.

Unless mariadb has become the default, I strongly prefer to keep
standard mysql as the database on ubuntu (precise or otherwise).

Closes-Bug: 1395776

Change-Id: I6664054ba52d03814cea846cb0d79cd853632814

commit_message:
Adding GPFS Manila driver

Supporing GPFS exports over kernel NFS and Ganesha NFS
Supporting following Manila functionality:
1. Create, List, Delete Shares
2. Create, List, Delete Share Snapshots
3. Create Share from a Share Snapshot
4. Allow, Deny access to a share based on IP

Supports, local and remote GPFS nodes to the Manila service node,
in a GPFS cluster

Limitation:
1. While using remote GPFS node, with Ganesha NFS, 'gpfs_private_key'
for remote login to the GPFS node must be specified and there must be
a passwordless authentication already setup between the Manila and the
remote GPFS node.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint gpfs-driver
Change-Id: I6664054ba52d03814cea846cb0d79cd853632814

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-11-24 15:33:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/api/v2/stubs.py', 'cinder/api/v2/volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py'], 'message': 'Add ability to create volume from image by image name.

Some cli commands allow specifying an image by either
its name or its ID. Creating a volume from an image
currently requires knowing the image ID. The request
was made to add the ability to create a volume using
the image name instead.

This patch adds the ability to accept either name or ID.
It will attempt to locate the image based on this input
and fail if neither can be matched. If found by name, it
will also verify there are not multiple images of the
same name. If this is the case it will require using the
ID to be explicit.

Will update python-cinderclient in a separate patch once
this has been merged to allow ID or name.

Change-Id: I8b522ccff3ead644b738499e67fa85d4ab92af36
Partial-Bug: #1377823
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to create volume from image by image name.

Some cli commands allow specifying an image by either
its name or its ID. Creating a volume from an image
currently requires knowing the image ID. The request
was made to add the ability to create a volume using
the image name instead.

This patch adds the ability to accept either name or ID.
It will attempt to locate the image based on this input
and fail if neither can be matched. If found by name, it
will also verify there are not multiple images of the
same name. If this is the case it will require using the
ID to be explicit.

Will update python-cinderclient in a separate patch once
this has been merged to allow ID or name.

Change-Id: I8b522ccff3ead644b738499e67fa85d4ab92af36
Partial-Bug: #1377823

subject: CORE-2188 Make ironic fail quickly if possible
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-03 13:36:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/client_wrapper.py'], 'message': 'CORE-2188 Make ironic fail quickly if possible

Ironic returns 409 for various transient reasons when it's holding
locks etc. These requests might well succeed if retried, but 409
is also returned for more permanent reasons such as "already booting
an instance on this host". To fail-fast in the second case, this
patch hacks in a check on the error message in case of a 409.

This is temporary - a better-designed fix is being planned upstream
by Ironic cores. See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/
2014-November/051770.html

Change-Id: If6133bd5d52c725c7115262f87821621c87dbd57
Upstream-ref: none
'}]
commit_message:
CORE-2188 Make ironic fail quickly if possible

Ironic returns 409 for various transient reasons when it's holding
locks etc. These requests might well succeed if retried, but 409
is also returned for more permanent reasons such as "already booting
an instance on this host". To fail-fast in the second case, this
patch hacks in a check on the error message in case of a 409.

This is temporary - a better-designed fix is being planned upstream
by Ironic cores. See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/
2014-November/051770.html

Change-Id: If6133bd5d52c725c7115262f87821621c87dbd57
Upstream-ref: none

commit_message:
Made changes to make vhd overhead configurable.

Changes were made to make the vhd overhead
for xenserver configurable in nova.conf.
Due to an issue with larger base images this
value should be configurable, rather than a
static fixed 10 GB value as it currently sits.

Closes-Bug: 1326156
DocImpact
Change-Id: I9cc39d55844976787888a817e44da14b2e6cb1d6

commit_message:
ignore .idea folder in neutron

If we use JetBrains PyCharm as python develop tool, JetBrains PyCharm
would automatically generate its config folder name .idea in the root
dir of your python code.
Many Code projects, such as nova and cinder, have ignore .idea folder.
Project neutron should also ignore .idea folder.

Change-Id: If88f8c3ef219157e7040241d63bcf30dd6aedb0a
Closes-Bug: #1362454

commit_message:
Allow DevStack to retry DNS queries to handle async CRUD

With pool-manager, records are created/deleted asynchronously, so we update
the DevStack code to implement a retry+timeout on DNS queries.

Additionally, move exercises only functions into the exercises script.

Change-Id: Ic94fac4c4a2845780c24e9489d39b4f2f39a1d55
Closes-Bug: 1398786

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9387, 'name': 'Aleksandr Didenko', 'email': 'adidenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AD'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-03 11:43:15.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/cluster_ha.pp'], 'message': "Allow user to disable VIP ping resource

Allow user to disable VIP ping resource
if user does not need public network
to be routable.

Since 5.1.1 and 6.0 releases FUEL configures ping resource that checks whether default gateway is accessible in order to fix the corresponding bug:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1370510

Nevertheless, this fix imposes the issue that if user does not have pingable default gateway, deployment of OpenStack cluster will fail as FUEL uses public VIP to configure some of OpenStack entities (e.g. floating ip pools). In order to work this around, user can specify any pingable host as a default gateway, e.g. FUEL master node or apply the patch above and change cluster attribute 'run_ping_checker' to 'false' that will disable the pinger resource. In order to do this user will need to use FUEL CLI and add this parameter manually to the deployment cluster attributes.

Also, be aware that disabling of pinger will introduce back the corresponding bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1370510 

DocImpact
Change-Id: I9e1f29b5ee08ec7276175de213dcdae392251045
Related-bug: #1396126"}]
commit_message:
Allow user to disable VIP ping resource

Allow user to disable VIP ping resource
if user does not need public network
to be routable.

Since 5.1.1 and 6.0 releases FUEL configures ping resource that checks whether default gateway is accessible in order to fix the corresponding bug:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1370510

Nevertheless, this fix imposes the issue that if user does not have pingable default gateway, deployment of OpenStack cluster will fail as FUEL uses public VIP to configure some of OpenStack entities (e.g. floating ip pools). In order to work this around, user can specify any pingable host as a default gateway, e.g. FUEL master node or apply the patch above and change cluster attribute 'run_ping_checker' to 'false' that will disable the pinger resource. In order to do this user will need to use FUEL CLI and add this parameter manually to the deployment cluster attributes.

Also, be aware that disabling of pinger will introduce back the corresponding bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1370510 

DocImpact
Change-Id: I9e1f29b5ee08ec7276175de213dcdae392251045
Related-bug: #1396126

commit_message:
Add networking-odl project to StackForge

This repo will be used for development of OpenDaylight drivers necessary for
OpenDaylight to run with Neutron.

The need of setting this repo up is inline with spec proposal [1], where core
elements of the Neutron project are decoupled by the internals of the
technology being supported.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/134680/

Change-Id: Ice4f782b95637b7afd638ddb041a079e86ea6f22

commit_message:
Drop old code from SecurityGroupAgentRpcApiMixin

The SecurityGroupAgentRpcApiMixin class temporarily had support for
both RpcProxy and new oslo.messaging style rpc client interfaces.  Now
that all users of this mixin have been converted to direct usage of
oslo.messaging APIs, the old compatibility code can be removed.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I18dc65e7f14a8ae42e3c2bc81d1d73f61c12c1fc

commit_message:
Do not leave tasks in running state

1. Set 'ready' state to task if is in 'running' state after execution.
2. Log final states of such tasks.
Test added.

Related-Bug: #1394495

Change-Id: I53bdbc62de705a57f5411529617e22e769b0ed35

subject: Add job to publish puppet modules to the forge
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6039, 'name': 'Joni Harker', 'email': 'code@gentlydownthe.net', 'username': 'jesusaurus'}, {'_account_id': 6316, 'name': 'Anita Kuno', 'email': 'anteaya@anteaya.info', 'username': 'anteaya'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 6554, 'name': 'Spencer Krum', 'email': 'nibz@spencerkrum.com', 'username': 'krum-spencer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-18 17:25:15.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add job to publish puppet modules to the forge

Puppet blacksmith is a ruby gem that can handle pushing new puppet
modules to the puppet forge. Right now we don't have an automated
way to push to the forge, so this is a big win. Added it to the
'release' pipeline. This job runs on the 'pypi' node which is
pypi.slave.o.o, this node is not a single use node and is trusted
with secrets for pypi uploads, maven uploads, and jenkins plugin
uploads. When this node goes trusty, it might make sense for it
to be renamed 'trusted.'

A limitation of puppet-blacksmith is that it can only source one
set of credentials. I am working on patches to allow it to handle
different credentials with a config option. This would be needed
to publish both the openstack-infra modules and the stackforge
modules.

Puppet-blacksmith does not run any user-submitted code, so it is
safe to do the entire operation on the trusted node.

Change-Id: I0c122828df6f231d1c20b8680e5bf2c90894ad62
"}]
commit_message:
Add job to publish puppet modules to the forge

Puppet blacksmith is a ruby gem that can handle pushing new puppet
modules to the puppet forge. Right now we don't have an automated
way to push to the forge, so this is a big win. Added it to the
'release' pipeline. This job runs on the 'pypi' node which is
pypi.slave.o.o, this node is not a single use node and is trusted
with secrets for pypi uploads, maven uploads, and jenkins plugin
uploads. When this node goes trusty, it might make sense for it
to be renamed 'trusted.'

A limitation of puppet-blacksmith is that it can only source one
set of credentials. I am working on patches to allow it to handle
different credentials with a config option. This would be needed
to publish both the openstack-infra modules and the stackforge
modules.

Puppet-blacksmith does not run any user-submitted code, so it is
safe to do the entire operation on the trusted node.

Change-Id: I0c122828df6f231d1c20b8680e5bf2c90894ad62

Remove usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from the ml2
AgentNotifierApi.  The equivalent oslo.messaging APIs are now used
instead.  A couple of other mixin APIs had to be converted at the same
time.

Note that there is one very minor functional change here.  The base
rpc version is set to '1.0' now instead of '1.1'.  The right pattern
to use is to always set the base to be N.0.  Any method that needs a
newer version should specify it.

Change-Id: I640568e2d73c9eb7a9505db640dc1427a1ae2abe
"}]
commit_message:
Drop RpcProxy usage from ml2 AgentNotifierApi

Remove usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from the ml2
AgentNotifierApi.  The equivalent oslo.messaging APIs are now used
instead.  A couple of other mixin APIs had to be converted at the same
time.

Note that there is one very minor functional change here.  The base
rpc version is set to '1.0' now instead of '1.1'.  The right pattern
to use is to always set the base to be N.0.  Any method that needs a
newer version should specify it.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I640568e2d73c9eb7a9505db640dc1427a1ae2abe

commit_message:
EMC ECS ( Elastic Cloud Storage ) Driver

This patch implements Cinder iSCSI, FC drivers and adds a
ScaleIO volume driver.

It performs volume operations using
1) Cinder Block Volume Driver for EMC ECS
2) Cinder iSCSI and FC Block Volume Driver for EMC ViPR to manage
EMC storage systems ÎíÎñ VMAX, VNX and VPLEX.

It supports all required driver features.

Certificate Test Results
    https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1337455

CCLA SCHEDULE B SUBMISSION

Change-Id: Ibe6e2634b5b67713a6670162bfa00bc7dd6b9b45
Implements: blueprint emc-ecs-driver

Add more info to exception.
