commit_message:
Hook CPU pinning checking into claims

This patch adds the ability to test claims against CPU pinning data exposed
by the host and instance. This is currently a no-op as no code in the
API will actually set any pinning constraints for the instance.
Since getting the CPU pinning information  of the instance may require an
additional db roundtrip, we try to avoid getting it unless absolutely
necessary.

The resource tracker will not do any actual usage tracking yet - this
will be done in a follow-up patch.

Change-Id: I2ee20843ce6b5dbade9b45bd711dd8e544a59433
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning

commit_message:
Expose numa_topology to the resource tracker

This patch makes all the current drivers that implement
get_available_resource() return an additional 'cpu_pinning' field in
the resources dict. The libvirt driver will actually return useful data,
while other drivers only return 'None' at this time.

We also make the resource tracker check for the presence of this field.
The intent is that it will  be mandatory for all drivers to expose.

Change-Id: Ieee12706a1dddade610a2af2167c3f59838d9102
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning

commit_message:
libvirt: Add method for getting host cpu_pinning

We can get this information from the libvirt capabilities XML, so we
add a method that returns it in the form of
virt.hardware.VirtCPUPinningTopology objects. We will exclude any CPUs not
found in the CONF.vcpu_pin_set.

We also fix how siblings were reported in the host capabilities fixture
in driver tests, as we now actually use this data.

Change-Id: I13388eda2a79d960f6e91377e32c9bedb490bdb1
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning

commit_message:
Add cpu_pinning to Instance object.

Make sure that cpu_pinning is an actual attribute on the Instance
object, and add functionality for creating/lazy-loading/saving pinning
information through the Instance object.

Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning

Change-Id: Ib8573cef19ee09fe0be0ba71fa6d2d339f8b6ce3

Add InstanceCPUPinning and related objects

We add the objects so that we can support future versioning of the data,
and for ease of db retrieval when using the Instance object.

Change-Id: If70d5ad285a349e163b3d07b6dfe0d2c64072dd8
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning

commit_message:
Add cpu_pinning to instance_extra table

Add a new text column, cpu_pinning, to the instance_extra table. This
column will hold data about instance CPU pinning that will be needed for
scheduling and compute node resource updates.

Change-Id: I568de91b2ccb5daf16c45056b31f26f94efc3c98
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning

commit_message:
Add method for getting the CPU pinning constraint

We add a method that when passed flavor with extra spec containing
hw:cpu_policy key, and an optional NUMA topology instance,
calculates the CPU pinning constraint for the instance (or None if the
instance is not be pinned). In case admin doesn't specify a shared pinning
policy on the flavor, users are free to override it with image metadata
hw_cpu_policy, otherwise, attempts to override it will result in an
error.

This will be done at boot time and then persisted to be used later in
scheduling.

Change-Id: I1793ce0288aa97d7a7cac3df1ca84c48935ec46b
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning

commit_message:
Add NUMA support for CPU pinning logic

This commit adds additonal classes to hold per-NUMA cell pinning
information for hosts and instances, and expose similar methods as for
(now) Cell classes that calculate usage and provide the claiming logic.

Future commits will add the logic for parsing flavor extra specs/image
metadata to determine the VirtInstanceCPUPinning info for each instance
based on the pinning requested as well as topology and NUMA preferences.

Change-Id: Ida6f25e0459b0221f8597fee1d6f9e44b33c9f2e
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2014-10-30 18:07:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/virt/hardware.py'], 'message': 'Add hardware CPU pinning types and pinning logic

This patch adds the basic classes to represent host and instance CPU
pinning data (following suite with the work done for NUMA topology).

The classes come with basic pinning logic that will allow us to make
pinning placements taking into consideration hyperthreading capabilities
of the host (and instances if set).

At the moment NUMA topology is _not_ considered, however the same
packing logic will apply to each NUMA cell individually. This patch is
presented without the added complexity so that it can more easily be
used for discussions on the packing logic itself.

Follow up patch will introduce NUMA awareness when doing CPU pinning

Change-Id: I77ef90c17fc54bd11f0d7a562e04eef71e7b228e
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning
'}]
commit_message:
Add hardware CPU pinning types and pinning logic

This patch adds the basic classes to represent host and instance CPU
pinning data (following suite with the work done for NUMA topology).

The classes come with basic pinning logic that will allow us to make
pinning placements taking into consideration hyperthreading capabilities
of the host (and instances if set).

At the moment NUMA topology is _not_ considered, however the same
packing logic will apply to each NUMA cell individually. This patch is
presented without the added complexity so that it can more easily be
used for discussions on the packing logic itself.

Follow up patch will introduce NUMA awareness when doing CPU pinning

Change-Id: I77ef90c17fc54bd11f0d7a562e04eef71e7b228e
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning

commit_message:
Change description of default security group

The description for default security group in neutron
is “default”.
This confuses the end users, so updated the description
from “default” to “Default security group”.
Closes-Bug: #1291570

Change-Id: I9e024de935e8d17afd3d459cfa17e9feb0cd79fa

commit_message:
Add new package-installs system

We currently support package-installs definitions which has some
limitations and oddities. This new format requires only one definition
which does not reside in our run-parts directories and follows a
consistent naming scheme (package-installs.yaml).

Change-Id: Ie51a7c4fdc15634ae8e069728e5e07cc1dc36095

commit_message:
Change event type for identity trust notifications

Our identity trust notification event type do not match keystone
event type for these notifications. This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I73c4ce9334a26574f3b2c83244ea67b219bec920
Closes-bug: #1392326
(cherry picked from commit 31350c54cb8d56880cd0b72811c532d07f8f5a28)

commit_message:
Use configdrive with Ironic

This blueprint adds support for configdrive for the Ironic virt driver,
to enable Nova to pass a configdrive to Ironic, to be used when
deploying a bare metal instance.

Change-Id: Ia4444060c58c86908c680e7401731ec5c26f82c7

commit_message:
Deactivate LV before lvremove

This is mostly to try to isolate some of the failures that are
being seen at removal time.  I'm hoping this will help reveal
more about what is going wrong.

Change-Id: I0e7cf079301eb18d7965284614c65c6535fff409

commit_message:
Isolate scheduler DB for Instance Groups

Identifies work needed in the scheduler and nova code to eliminate DB
access by scheduler when filtering on instance group hints. This is one
part of preparing for the scheduler forklift.

Change-Id: Ie8dc237274a6891e353703efeaa6f4ab79bc6360
Implements: blueprint isolate-scheduler-db

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-25 11:40:33.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/block_device.py', 'cinder/volume/iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': 'Remove global conf settings from iscsi helper

This "intermediate" iscsi helper pulls all of it's
config settings from the global config.  This is fine
if you only have a single backend, but if you do
multi-backend it puts things in a bad state where some
of the backend specific settings are picked up but
others are not (for example iscsi_ip_address).

This change modifies methods like create_export in
the volume/iscsi helper to take the drivers version
of the config settings as a parameter and use those
instead of setting off of the global values.

Long term there's a lot of cleanup surrounding our
inheritance model and especially the iscsi helpers.
We can address that going forward but here we just want
to fix the bug in the safest way possible.

Change-Id: If17ec3ffb3f4ea7f95da65781885dcd613b1a807
Closes-Bug: 1325799
(cherry picked from commit 1b21d499bb3bb1e94e2815cbada86db8e8e21406)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove global conf settings from iscsi helper

This "intermediate" iscsi helper pulls all of it's
config settings from the global config.  This is fine
if you only have a single backend, but if you do
multi-backend it puts things in a bad state where some
of the backend specific settings are picked up but
others are not (for example iscsi_ip_address).

This change modifies methods like create_export in
the volume/iscsi helper to take the drivers version
of the config settings as a parameter and use those
instead of setting off of the global values.

Long term there's a lot of cleanup surrounding our
inheritance model and especially the iscsi helpers.
We can address that going forward but here we just want
to fix the bug in the safest way possible.

Change-Id: If17ec3ffb3f4ea7f95da65781885dcd613b1a807
Closes-Bug: 1325799
(cherry picked from commit 1b21d499bb3bb1e94e2815cbada86db8e8e21406)

commit_message:
Add advsvc role to neutron policy file

Add in a default "advsvc" user and the logic in the Neutron policy
infrastructure which will allow this user to create/get/update/delete
ports on other tenants networks, as well as view other tenants
networks. This is for the use case of letting advanced services have
a user to put ports on other tenants networks. By default, we do not
define any roles for the policy "context_is_advsvc", but rely on
operators to specify the likely value of "role advsvc".

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1331836

Change-Id: I94cb3383eb1fed793934719603f888dbbdbbd85a
Co-Authored-By: Susanne Balle <sleipnir012@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d4f00659eb18c6a5df2ce6d35202b0a4a9409f70)

subject: Add a Quobyte Volume Driver in Nova
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-02 14:19:28.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/quobyte-nova-driver.rst'], 'message': 'Add a Quobyte Volume Driver in Nova

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/quobyte-nova-driver

Add a Nova volume driver for the `Quobyte Unified Storage Plane
<http://quobyte.com/>`_ storage system, allowing to attach vm images residing
in Quobyte USP to Nova instances. These images (raw, qcow2) are stored as
files on a Quobyte USP volume.

Change-Id: I33726d210aac4f02cdb3cb00e9a848c1322b7596
'}]
commit_message:
Add a Quobyte Volume Driver in Nova

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/quobyte-nova-driver

Add a Nova volume driver for the `Quobyte Unified Storage Plane
<http://quobyte.com/>`_ storage system, allowing to attach vm images residing
in Quobyte USP to Nova instances. These images (raw, qcow2) are stored as
files on a Quobyte USP volume.

Change-Id: I33726d210aac4f02cdb3cb00e9a848c1322b7596

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-01 10:49:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py'], 'message': 'VMware: prevent exception with migrate_disk_and_power_off

Commit 8e4a9156f4dccf003970848c28b8a9d15c55212d ensured that
all instance operations that do not require a cluster or
volume will make use of the base _vmops class.

The method migrate_disk_and_power_off was missed.

Change-Id: Ibfdd9407905acc5e9a3e3a97a76fb2e35a68e817
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: prevent exception with migrate_disk_and_power_off

Commit 8e4a9156f4dccf003970848c28b8a9d15c55212d ensured that
all instance operations that do not require a cluster or
volume will make use of the base _vmops class.

The method migrate_disk_and_power_off was missed.

Change-Id: Ibfdd9407905acc5e9a3e3a97a76fb2e35a68e817

commit_message:
Compute: catch correct exception when host does not exists

The method get_by_compute_host will raise ComputeHostNotFound
if there requested host does not exist. This patch ensures that
we catch the correct exception.

Change-Id: Iabed5366f73a02bba748852368685647be9a965d

commit_message:
Added db API layer for CRUD operations on instance tags

Added database API layer which allow following:
- add tag to the instance
- replace set of instance tags with new set of tags
- get all instance tags
- remove specified tag from instance
- remove all tags from instance

Implements: blueprint tag-instances
Change-Id: I43b5b22dff79b14f352ff511f8815fc81b14b923

commit_message:
Use "is_neutron_security_groups" check

Module nova.network.security_group.openstack_driver contains
"is_neutron_security_groups" method, which checks that neutron is
turned on as security groups API.

This method can be reused in several places, so code duplication
will be reduced.

Change-Id: I7af1833772a4b6e5119c189554866c46466fcf06

Extract all the logging related setup calls into a separate method in
test.py. This includes providing context in the docstring for why we
do these things.

It also changes the WARN level overrides to only happen if we are
running > DEBUG, if we actually were running with the OS_DEBUG

commit_message:
factor out _setup_logging in test.py

Extract all the logging related setup calls into a separate method in
test.py. This includes providing context in the docstring for why we
do these things.

It also changes the WARN level overrides to only happen if we are
running > DEBUG, if we actually were running with the OS_DEBUG
override one would expect everything to be running at the DEBUG level.

Change-Id: I4ce3967f2ed4143ba2a1c78606604e1edc2e818e

Cleaning up the base test.py to be a little more understandable about
what is going on, the chunks of work being accomplished, and why. This
will hopefully make it possible to pull some of this work out of tests
that don't need it.

The ReplaceModule fixture is buggy and very sensitive to the sequence

This removes the use of ReplaceModule for fake_ldap. Unwinding the

commit_message:
remove test.ReplaceModule from test.py

The ReplaceModule fixture is buggy and very sensitive to the sequence
things are imported in. It was only used in 3 places until the
functional test split landed (and had to be removed from there).

This removes the use of ReplaceModule for fake_ldap. Unwinding the
xenapi test code is a bit more challenging especially given how
spidery all that code is. So instead of fixing that move the
ReplaceModule into the xenapi test code where it's used and leave it
as an exercise for the xenapi folks to move to more real mocks or
monkey patching.

This gets it out of test.py so that no one else will accidentally use
it.

Hyper-V: Refactors Hyper-V VMOps unit tests

The Hyper-V driver oldest tests (test_hypervapi.py) are proving hard to
maintain.

The tests in test_hypervapi.py in particular can also be refactored and
split in separate TestCases, one of each *ops module.

This commit refactors some unit tests from VMOps, necessary for the
next commits..

Partially implements: blueprint hyper-v-test-refactoring

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-24 23:25:10.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'sahara/conductor/api.py', 'sahara/db/api.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/conductor/manager/test_edp.py', 'sahara/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': "Support searching job executions by cluster name and job name

As a convenience, allow job execution searches to be filtered by
'cluster.name' and 'job.name' fields in addition to the fields
in a JobExecution.  These fields refer to the names of the Cluster
object and Job object linked to by the  JobExecution. If these
search terms are present in the JobExecution lookup, SQL joins
will be added to accomplish the search.

Partial-implements: blueprint enable-result-filtering
Change-Id: Ibdffa81c6e15e3863d40bdb544721defea1d41fd
"}]
commit_message:
Support searching job executions by cluster name and job name

As a convenience, allow job execution searches to be filtered by
'cluster.name' and 'job.name' fields in addition to the fields
in a JobExecution.  These fields refer to the names of the Cluster
object and Job object linked to by the  JobExecution. If these
search terms are present in the JobExecution lookup, SQL joins
will be added to accomplish the search.

Partial-implements: blueprint enable-result-filtering
Change-Id: Ibdffa81c6e15e3863d40bdb544721defea1d41fd

maintain.

test_hypervapi.

commit_message:
add abandon_old_reviews script

This is an automated script to abandon the reviews that we agreed as a
community are beyond stale.

No activity for 4w with a -2 on them or No activity for 4w and Jenkins
doesn't have a +1 or better on it.

Can be run by any core reviewer.

Change-Id: I19636f04b691c0b74af306709d54b26978c19282

commit_message:
initialize objects with context in network manager tests

These changes aim to clean up the pattern of passing a context in
object member functions create/destroy/refresh/save and instead
initialize the object with the context when it's constructed.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: Ia27e0952d396f1a4c9c520faeeb18517a394ab9b

commit_message:
initialize objects with context in flavors

These changes aim to clean up the pattern of passing a context in
object member functions create/destroy/refresh/save and instead
initialize the object with the context when it's constructed.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: Ib3e9a05c50c0fdf3e4b9cfe2770a3ba707755367

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-12-01 18:13:46.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/neutron/router.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron.py'], 'message': 'Change RouterInterface resource's name

This patch remove previous name building logic
and adds data() supporting in handle_create and
handle_delete. If name looked like
'router_id:"subnet_id"=subnet_id' or similar with port_id
earlier, now resource's name looks like 'router_id'
and RouterInterface uses data() methods. Also, it
supports compatibility with old resources, which
names look like 'router_id:subnet_id="subnet_id"' or
'router_id:subnet_id'. Besides that, patch adds attributes

Change-Id: Ie663e8d7c628b00ce862409417e67e808af39483
'}]
commit_message:
Change RouterInterface resource's name

This patch remove previous name building logic
and adds data() supporting in handle_create and
handle_delete. If name looked like
'router_id:"subnet_id"=subnet_id' or similar with port_id
earlier, now resource's name looks like 'router_id'
and RouterInterface uses data() methods. Also, it
supports compatibility with old resources, which
names look like 'router_id:subnet_id="subnet_id"' or
'router_id:subnet_id'. Besides that, patch adds attributes
router_id, subnet_id and port_id to the resource.

Change-Id: Ie663e8d7c628b00ce862409417e67e808af39483

commit_message:
Document the upgrade plans

This covers the plan for zero downtime upgrades. It looks at all the
building blocks we have in place, and a few we have planned for kilo and
pulls that into a process that we hope will deliver zero downtime
upgrades.

This is just an initial stake in the ground to help drive the upgrade
efforts during kilo.

Change-Id: I3974d18f79ba655257dcac49208821bc191d8cc5

commit_message:
Convert strutils to oslo.utils.encodeutils

Convert the encode/decode functions from oslo-incubator to use
oslo.utils encodeutils, as the incubator functions are now
deprecated.

Also syncs oslo-incubator to 62394a3 to purge usage of strutils
from the openstack/common modules.

Note includes oslo fix https://review.openstack.org/#/c/133290/
which we need or the python3 tests won't pass.

Change-Id: I630fe3f3ce14ae745a8417bfe6552acd31341c9c
Partial-Bug: #1380629

commit_message:
VMware: enable VMware driver to use new BDM format

This patch makes the necessary changes in the driver to enable
it to use some of the features of the new block device mapping format.

After this patch it will be possible to set the bus, and device_type per
block device.

Change-Id: Idcf3dd97c3baacd77d03616b5b2dd768acf46de4

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-11-21 22:42:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_wsgi.py', 'nova/wsgi.py'], 'message': "Eventlet green threads not released back to pool

Presently, the wsgi server allows persist connections hence even after
the response is sent to the client, it doesn't close the client socket
connection.
Because of this problem, the green thread is not released back to the pool.

In order to close the client socket connection explicitly after the
response is sent and read successfully by the client, you simply have to
set keepalive to False when you create a wsgi server.

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet socket timeout
behaviour. Allows closing idle client connections after a period of
time, eg:

$ time nc localhost 8776
real    1m0.063s

Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact:
Added wsgi_keep_alive option (default=True).
Added client_socket_timeout option (default=900).

SecurityImpact

Closes-Bug: #1361360
Change-Id: I399b812f6d452226fd306c423de8dcea8520d2aa
"}]
commit_message:
Eventlet green threads not released back to pool

Presently, the wsgi server allows persist connections hence even after
the response is sent to the client, it doesn't close the client socket
connection.
Because of this problem, the green thread is not released back to the pool.

In order to close the client socket connection explicitly after the
response is sent and read successfully by the client, you simply have to
set keepalive to False when you create a wsgi server.

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet socket timeout
behaviour. Allows closing idle client connections after a period of
time, eg:

$ time nc localhost 8776
real    1m0.063s

Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact:
Added wsgi_keep_alive option (default=True).
Added client_socket_timeout option (default=900).

SecurityImpact

Closes-Bug: #1361360
Change-Id: I399b812f6d452226fd306c423de8dcea8520d2aa

commit_message:
Add adopt-oslo-versionedobjects spec

This spec proposes adopting the versioned objects infrastructure currently
used by Nova and Ironic as oslo-versionedobjects.

Change-Id: If7212a7d83cd0fb630c60ee0e87d44a8db0a3e63

commit_message:
Make nova-api use quotas object for create_security_group

This converts create_security_group in nova-api to using the
quotas object -- this is the last of the nova-api calls still
using the quota module.

Change-Id: I160e617ed108e3db0ea167b0a57b9305098179e6

commit_message:
libvirt: do not shade module uuid with local variable

There was a variable 'uuid' inside a method that was shading the
imported module 'uuid'

Change-Id: Ied08dac3765613a5477970536603d5232d6ddc14

Make nova-api use quotas object for count() and limit_check()

This commit converts nova-api to using the quotas object
for the count() and limit_check() calls.

Change-Id: I4e0462d3fdc385bf815862fa0d8fe891665e1b14

commit_message:
Add count and limit_check methods to quota object

This allows the quota object to pass through count() and
limit_check() methods to the quota engine, removing the
need for importing the quota module directly

Change-Id: Id8c10c606693d4149913d7cec2e88fc1809bbddb

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-02 03:55:33.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-storage-node.xml'], 'message': 'Fix error configuration for container/object-server.conf

In the sections:
Edit the /etc/swift/container-server.conf file and complete the
following actions:

[pipeline:main]
pipeline = healthcheck recon account-server

account-server should read: healthcheck recon container-server

and

Edit the /etc/swift/object-server.conf file and complete the following
actions:

[pipeline:main]
pipeline = healthcheck recon account-server

account-server should be object-server

backport: juno

Change-Id: I43d298ae1dbde56835c7db03e985eaf5351c43cf
Closes-bug: #1398131
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error configuration for container/object-server.conf

In the sections:
Edit the /etc/swift/container-server.conf file and complete the
following actions:

[pipeline:main]
pipeline = healthcheck recon account-server

account-server should read: healthcheck recon container-server

and

Edit the /etc/swift/object-server.conf file and complete the following
actions:

[pipeline:main]
pipeline = healthcheck recon account-server

account-server should be object-server

backport: juno

Change-Id: I43d298ae1dbde56835c7db03e985eaf5351c43cf
Closes-bug: #1398131
